attributes.review: As a dedicated follower of â€œhe who shall not be namedâ€, I decided that I must step up my game. However, once the app finished downloading to my phone I heard my baby screaming from the other roommate. Of course being the loving pet mother I am, ran towards my screeching baby, only to discover that my poor child-dragon has mysteriously set on fire. I had my phone in my hand while approaching them and still had the app open, mind you. That poor baby kept running from me until I closed the app and deleted it, right before writing a strong reviews on how toxic this app is to dragons. These developers need to fix this weird bug because we both live in fear of this app and the capabilities of it!
attributes.title: My pet dragon mysteriously set on fire

I donâ€™t know why my info is getting sold to untrustworthy people or companies but it quite frankly scared me. I decided to uninstall the app because I really donâ€™t want people who could be dangerous to know my information and keep digging for more. For me this app was a giant scam that sold some of my private information to unreliable, uncredible, and dangerous sources...I donâ€™t recommend.

attributes.review: I downloaded this app, which took a while, but when I opened it it asked for my private personal information so as most people should do, I went to the terms and service and the privacy policy. While I was there, my phone kept crashing which makes it seem like either the app is sucky and canâ€™t function properly or the homophobic, transphobic, and racist rapist running it is trying to hide something from us. I was able to get so far as to read that the app has the right to share your info with any third party service without listing or linking any of the services used, which means once our info is shared with those companies, we have no idea what they are doing with it.
attributes.title: Eww
